item.title: 亚洲顶级音乐市场日本尝试向世界推销流行音乐
item.description: 在韩国流行音乐粉丝聚集的 KCON LA 音乐节上，新秀音乐组合 XG 翻唱了 2NE1 组合 2011 年的成名曲《I Am the Best》，引起了巨大反响。【原文：The rookie music group XG drew a huge roar at the KCON LA festival, a gathering of Korean pop music fans, with a cover of I Am the Best, a 2011 hit from the group 2NE1.】

item.title: 泰国立法者在延迟后批准了 960 亿美元的预算法案
item.description: 泰国国会批准了 2024 财年近 960 亿美元的支出计划，为总理沙维信（Srettha Thavisin）政府增加公共开支以支持东南亚第二大经济体扫清了障碍。【原文：Thailand’s parliament approved a nearly $96 billion spending plan for the 2024 fiscal year, belatedly clearing the way for Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin’s administration to ramp up public spending to support Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 乌克兰袭击加剧通胀风险，俄罗斯维持利率不变
开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。在央行乐观情绪的推动下，股市将迎来今年以来最好的一周，交易员在等待美联储发言人的到来，而体育用品公司则将面临艰难的一天。以下是市场动态。【原文：Good morning. Stocks head for best week this year on central bank optimism, traders wait for Fed speakers and sportswear firms face a tough day. Here’s what’s moving markets. — David Goodman】

item.title: 据说阿曼国有能源公司将选择银行将两家单位上市
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿曼国有能源公司 OQ SAOC 已选定汇丰控股公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）和摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）等银行为其两个部门的首次公开募股计划提供服务。【原文：Oman’s state energy company OQ SAOC has picked banks including HSBC Holdings Plc and Morgan Stanley to work on the planned initial public offerings of two of its units, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度监管机构寻求限制外国 ETF 的新资金流入
item.description: 印度市场监管机构已要求本地基金经理停止接受投资海外交易所交易基金产品的新认购，因为此类投资的价值已接近全行业的上限。【原文：India’s markets regulator has asked local money managers to stop accepting new subscriptions for products that invest in overseas exchange-traded funds as the value of such investments nears an industry-wide limit.】

item.title: 美联储将把声誉寄托在 2% 的通胀目标上
item.description: 欢迎来到 "每周固定"（Weekly Fix），这是一份永远不会改变自己球门柱的时事通讯。我是跨资产记者凯蒂-格雷菲尔德（Katie Greifeld）。【原文：Welcome to the Weekly Fix, the newsletter that would never shift its own goal posts. I’m cross-asset reporter Katie Greifeld.】

item.title: 移民推动美国经济增长，政客却怒不可遏
item.description: 尽管美国移民数量的不断增加在全国各地的政治家中播下了分裂的种子，并在广大选民中激起了愤怒情绪，但在一个地方，几乎每个人似乎都站在同一战线，保持着乐观的态度：华尔街。【原文：While the rising number of immigrants in the US has sowed division among politicians across the country — and stoked angst among a swath of voters — there’s one place where almost everyone seems on the same, upbeat, page: Wall Street.】

item.title: 迪士尼董事会之争演变成一场竞赛，佩尔茨赢得支持
item.description: 首席执行官鲍勃-艾格（Bob Iger）在带领华特-迪斯尼公司度过了历史上最严重的衰退期后，似乎准备与亿万富翁、激进分子纳尔逊-佩尔茨（Nelson Peltz）争夺董事会席位。【原文：After steering Walt Disney Co. through one of its worst slumps in history, Chief Executive Officer Bob Iger looked poised to coast through a fight for board seats with billionaire activist Nelson Peltz.】

item.title: 花旗称欧洲股市创纪录涨势仍有上升空间
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup）的策略师认为，欧洲股市今年还将从目前的历史最高水平再攀升 6%。【原文：European stocks have another 6% to climb this year from current record-high levels, according to strategists at Citigroup.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长纳格尔称降息不会自动开始
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，欧洲央行放松货币政策的前景正在改善，但这并不一定意味着一旦开始这一进程，就会出现一连串的降息。【原文：The prospects for monetary easing by the European Central Bank are improving, though that doesn’t necessarily mean there’ll be a sequence of interest-rate reductions once the process begins, Governing Council member Joachim Nagel said.】

item.title: 尽管中国政府做出了努力，但中国对外投资再次放缓
item.description: 2 月份，新进入中国的外商投资再次放缓，对决策者最近为吸引更多海外资本进入世界第二大经济体所做的努力造成了打击。【原文：New foreign investment into China slowed again in February, dealing a blow to policymakers’ recent efforts to lure more overseas capital to the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 马来西亚在引起反响后放弃有争议的公民身份计划
item.description: 在公众对政府进行了数周的批评之后，马来西亚放弃了取消弃儿和被遗弃儿童自动获得公民身份的计划。【原文：Malaysia abandoned its plan to do away with automatic citizenship for foundlings and abandoned children, following weeks of public criticism against the government.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚爪哇岛东海岸发生 6.5 级地震
item.description: 印度尼西亚人口最多的岛屿爪哇岛东海岸发生 6.5 级地震，首都雅加达也有震感。【原文：A 6.5 magnitude earthquake struck off the eastern coast of Java, Indonesia’s most-populated island, with the tremors felt as far away as the capital Jakarta.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦将向中国借款 3 亿美元首次发行熊猫债券
item.description: 巴基斯坦新任财政部长表示，他希望今年首次出售高达 3 亿美元的熊猫债券，以吸引中国投资者。【原文：Pakistan’s new finance minister said he’s keen to tap Chinese investors by selling as much as $300 million in Panda bonds for the first time ever this year.】

item.title: 阿斯顿-马丁聘请宾利老板接任首席执行官一职
item.description: 阿斯顿-马丁聘请宾利首席执行官阿德里安-霍尔马克（Adrian Hallmark）接任首席执行官一职，以稳定这家与詹姆斯-邦德齐名的豪华汽车制造商。【原文：Aston Martin tapped Bentley’s chief executive officer, Adrian Hallmark, to take over as CEO and stabilize the luxury-car maker synonymous with James Bond.】

item.title: 德国商业前景改善程度远超预期
item.description: 德国商业前景的改善远超预期，这为德国经济从萎靡不振中复苏带来了希望。【原文：Germany’s business outlook improved much more than anticipated — feeding hopes that the economy will recover from a malaise that’s turned it into the euro zone’s laggard.】

item.title: 审计师称瑞典 Alecta 公司高管不应对失误负责
item.description: 一位审计师表示，瑞典最大的养老基金 Alecta 的董事会成员和首席执行官不应对导致 2023 年投资失败造成 31 亿美元损失的决策承担个人责任。【原文：Board members and chief executives at Sweden’s biggest pension fund Alecta should not be held personally liable for decisions that led to $3.1 billion in losses from failed investments in 2023, an auditor has said.】

item.title: 马来西亚以成本为由拒绝主办英联邦运动会的提议
item.description: 继澳大利亚之后，马来西亚也因成本问题拒绝了主办 2026 年英联邦运动会的机会，因为距离运动会开幕仅剩两年时间，主办方仍在继续寻找新的主办国。【原文：Malaysia followed Australia in declining an opportunity to host the 2026 Commonwealth Games due to cost concerns, as the organizers’ search for a new host continues with just two years left before the games start.】

item.title: 印度停止接收由 Sovcomflot 油轮运送的俄罗斯石油
item.description: 由于美国的制裁，印度所有的炼油厂现在都拒绝接受由 PJSC Sovcomflot 油轮运载的俄罗斯原油，这使得自两年前乌克兰入侵以来蓬勃发展的贸易进一步复杂化。【原文：All of India’s refiners are now refusing to take Russian crude carried on PJSC Sovcomflot tankers due to US sanctions, further complicating the trade that has flourished since the invasion of Ukraine two years ago.】

item.title: 美国银行称美联储会议前夕美股遭遇大量资金外流
item.description: 在美联储召开政策会议之前，美国股市出现大量资金外流，导致 S&P 500 指数创下历史新高。【原文：US stocks saw hefty outflows in the runup to the Federal Reserve’s policy meeting that took the S&P 500 Index to fresh all-time highs.】

item.title: 填补核电 5 万亿美元的缺口，银行无能为力
item.description: 本周，核能官员在公众日益支持原子能的浪潮中抵达布鲁塞尔。他们离开时，银行家们在评估其雄心的价格标签时反应平淡，令他们感到惭愧。【原文：Nuclear-energy officials arrived in Brussels this week amid a growing wave of public support for atomic power. They left humbled by the tepid reaction of bankers assessing the price tag of their ambitions.】

item.title: 欧洲股市有望创 2012 年以来最长赢利期
item.description: 周五，欧洲股市从纪录高位回落，但仍有望连续第九周上涨，这是自2012年以来最长的连涨期，因为市场对经济的信心不断增强，而且即将降息。【原文：European stocks fell back from record highs on Friday but were still on course for a ninth straight week of gains, the longest winning streak since 2012, amid growing confidence in the economy and upcoming interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 高德美（Galderma）首次上市交易大涨，推动欧洲首次公开募股复苏
item.description: 护肤品公司高德美集团（Galderma Group AG）在瑞士首次公开发行股票，成为过去二十年来最大的首次公开发行股票之一。【原文：Skin-care company Galderma Group AG surged in its trading debut following one of Switzerland’s biggest initial public offerings of the past two decades, delivering a much needed win for Europe’s equity capital markets.】

item.title: 发电量下降后巴基斯坦电费和通货膨胀率将上升
item.description: 上个月，巴基斯坦的发电量降至近四年来的最低点，这将推高电费和通货膨胀。【原文：Electricity generation in Pakistan fell to the lowest in almost four years last month, which will push up power bills and inflation.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行 "出色 "开局后实现 60 亿欧元资本回报
item.description: 桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）表示，经过强劲的开局，其股东今年有望获得超过 60 亿欧元（65 亿美元）的股息和回购。【原文：Banco Santander SA said its shareholders are on track for more than €6 billion ($6.5 billion) in dividends and buybacks for this year after a strong start.】

item.title: 中国敦促礼来公司在美国断供威胁下增加投资
item.description: 中国最高贸易官员敦促礼来公司（Eli Lilly & Co.【原文：China’s top trade official urged Eli Lilly & Co. to bolster its investment in the country, vowing to create vast opportunities for international pharmaceutical companies even as the US works to cut those ties.】

item.title: 据说 Samsonite 在考虑双重上市的同时仍保留收购选择权
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，在香港上市的箱包生产商森美国际公司（Samsonite International SA）正在考虑在美国两地上市，但私有化交易的可能性依然存在。【原文：Hong Kong-listed Samsonite International SA is keeping the possibility of a take-private deal open even as the luggage maker considers a dual listing in the US, according to people familiar with the matter.】
